se.simbio.encryption

Class Encryption

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.simbio.encryption.Encryption

  • public class Encryption
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to make more easy and simple the encrypt routines, this is the core of Encryption library

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Encryption.Builder
      This class is used to create an Encryption instance, you should provide ALL data or start with the Default Builder provided by the getDefaultBuilder method
      static interface  Encryption.Callback
      When you encrypt or decrypt in callback mode you get noticed of result using this interface

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String decrypt(java.lang.String data)
      Decrypt a String
      void decryptAsync(java.lang.String data, Encryption.Callback callback)
      This is a sugar method that calls decrypt method in background, it is a good idea to use this one instead the default method because decryption can take several time and with this method the process occurs in a AsyncTask, other advantage is the Callback with separated methods, one for success and other for the exception
      java.lang.String decryptOrNull(java.lang.String data)
      This is a sugar method that calls decrypt method and catch the exceptions returning null when it occurs and logging the error
      java.lang.String encrypt(java.lang.String data)
      Encrypt a String
      void encryptAsync(java.lang.String data, Encryption.Callback callback)
      This is a sugar method that calls encrypt method in background, it is a good idea to use this one instead the default method because encryption can take several time and with this method the process occurs in a AsyncTask, other advantage is the Callback with separated methods, one for success and other for the exception
      java.lang.String encryptOrNull(java.lang.String data)
      This is a sugar method that calls encrypt method and catch the exceptions returning null when it occurs and logging the error
      static Encryption getDefault(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String salt, byte[] iv)

    • Method Detail

      • getDefault

        public static Encryption getDefault(java.lang.String key,
                    java.lang.String salt,
                    byte[] iv)
        Returns:
        an default encryption instance or null if occur some Exception, you can create yur own Encryption instance using the Encryption.Builder

      • encrypt

        public java.lang.String encrypt(java.lang.String data)
                         throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        Encrypt a String
        Parameters:
        data - the String to be encrypted
        Returns:
        the encrypted String or null if you send the data as null
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the Builder charset name is not supported or if the Builder charset name is not supported
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the Builder digest algorithm is not available or if this has no installed provider that can provide the requested by the Builder secret key type or it is null, empty or in an invalid format
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - if no installed provider can provide the padding scheme in the Builder digest algorithm
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the specified parameters are inappropriate for the cipher
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the specified key can not be used to initialize the cipher instance
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the specified key specification cannot be used to generate a secret key
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - if the padding of the data does not match the padding scheme
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - if the size of the resulting bytes is not a multiple of the cipher block size
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the Builder digest algorithm is null or if the specified Builder secret key type is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cipher instance is not initialized for encryption or decryption

      • encryptOrNull

        public java.lang.String encryptOrNull(java.lang.String data)
        This is a sugar method that calls encrypt method and catch the exceptions returning null when it occurs and logging the error
        Parameters:
        data - the String to be encrypted
        Returns:
        the encrypted String or null if you send the data as null

      • encryptAsync

        public void encryptAsync(java.lang.String data,
                Encryption.Callback callback)
        This is a sugar method that calls encrypt method in background, it is a good idea to use this one instead the default method because encryption can take several time and with this method the process occurs in a AsyncTask, other advantage is the Callback with separated methods, one for success and other for the exception
        Parameters:
        data - the String to be encrypted
        callback - the Callback to handle the results

      • decrypt

        public java.lang.String decrypt(java.lang.String data)
                         throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        Decrypt a String
        Parameters:
        data - the String to be decrypted
        Returns:
        the decrypted String or null if you send the data as null
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the Builder charset name is not supported or if the Builder charset name is not supported
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the Builder digest algorithm is not available or if this has no installed provider that can provide the requested by the Builder secret key type or it is null, empty or in an invalid format
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - if no installed provider can provide the padding scheme in the Builder digest algorithm
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the specified parameters are inappropriate for the cipher
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the specified key can not be used to initialize the cipher instance
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the specified key specification cannot be used to generate a secret key
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - if the padding of the data does not match the padding scheme
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - if the size of the resulting bytes is not a multiple of the cipher block size
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the Builder digest algorithm is null or if the specified Builder secret key type is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cipher instance is not initialized for encryption or decryption

      • decryptOrNull

        public java.lang.String decryptOrNull(java.lang.String data)
        This is a sugar method that calls decrypt method and catch the exceptions returning null when it occurs and logging the error
        Parameters:
        data - the String to be decrypted
        Returns:
        the decrypted String or null if you send the data as null

      • decryptAsync

        public void decryptAsync(java.lang.String data,
                Encryption.Callback callback)
        This is a sugar method that calls decrypt method in background, it is a good idea to use this one instead the default method because decryption can take several time and with this method the process occurs in a AsyncTask, other advantage is the Callback with separated methods, one for success and other for the exception
        Parameters:
        data - the String to be decrypted
        callback - the Callback to handle the results
